audio_description: To make a perfect Aamai (tortoise) biryani, just do these three things right — that's enough for it to turn out amazing. I’ll tell you everything. First, let’s prepare the chili paste. I’ve soaked dry red chilies for an hour in hot water and added them to a jar.

audio_description: ...keep the flame on medium while sautéing. When sautéing, you’ll see that the garlic doesn’t stick out. Add two large tomatoes, finely chopped. Add a handful of mint, and an equal amount of chopped coriander. Chop them both finely.

audio_description: I’ve soaked seeraga samba rice for half an hour — that’s the rice you must use. Do not use basmati rice for this biryani. Only with seeraga samba will you get that superb, original taste. That’s when you’ll really notice the flavor. Once...

audio_description: I’ll tell you the water ratio: for 1 cup of seeraga samba rice, add 1.25 cups of water. Since we’ve already drained and added it, just 1 cup of water is enough. Now close the lid and cook it on dum (slow steam) for 10 minutes on low flame.
